com.xebialabs.overthere.ssh

Class SshConnectionBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xebialabs.overthere.ssh.SshConnectionBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OverthereConnectionBuilder

    public class SshConnectionBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements OverthereConnectionBuilder
    Builds SSH connections.

      static java.lang.String SET_EXECUTABLE_COMMAND
      Connection option (String) that specifies the command used to set the executable bit of a file/directory when using an SSH/SCP connection.
      static java.lang.String SET_EXECUTABLE_COMMAND_DEFAULT
      Default value (chmod a+x {0}) for the connection option that specifies the command used to make a file/directory executable using an SSH/SCP connection.

      static java.lang.String SET_NOT_EXECUTABLE_COMMAND_DEFAULT
      Default value (chmod a-x {0}) for the connection option that specifies the command used to make a file/directory not executable using an SSH/SCP connection.

      Connection option (String) that specifies the command used to copy files from the connection temporary directory when using an SSH/SUDO connection.

      Default value (cp -r {0} {1}) for the connection option that specifies the command used to copy files from the connection temporary directory while not preserving the file attributes using an SSH/SUDO connection.
      static java.lang.String SUDO_COPY_FROM_TEMP_FILE_COMMAND_DEFAULT_PRESERVE_ATTRIBUTES
      Default value (cp -pr {0} {1}) for the connection option that specifies the command used to copy files from the connection temporary directory while preserving the file attributes using an SSH/SUDO connection.
      static java.lang.String SUDO_COPY_TO_TEMP_FILE_COMMAND
      Connection option (String) that specifies the command used to copy files to the connection temporary directory when using an SSH/SUDO connection.

      Default value (cp -r {0} {1}) for the connection option that specifies the command used to copy files to the connection temporary directory while not preserving the file attributes using an SSH/SUDO connection.
      static java.lang.String SUDO_COPY_TO_TEMP_FILE_COMMAND_DEFAULT_PRESERVE_ATTRIBUTES
      Default value (cp -pr {0} {1}) for the connection option that specifies the command used to copy files to the connection temporary directory while preserving the file attributes using an SSH/SUDO connection.
      static java.lang.String SUDO_INTERACTIVE_PASSWORD
      Connection option (String) that specifies an alternate password to use for the password prompt for INTERACTIVE_SUDO SSH connections.
      static java.lang.String SUDO_OVERRIDE_UMASK
      Connection option (Boolean) that specifies whether or not to explicitly change the permissions with chmod -R go+rX after uploading a file or directory with scp.
      static java.lang.String SUDO_OVERRIDE_UMASK_COMMAND
      Connection option (String) that specifies the command used to override the umask after copying a file or directory when using an SSH/SUDO connection.
      static java.lang.String SUDO_OVERRIDE_UMASK_COMMAND_DEFAULT
      Default value (chmod -R go+rX {0}) for the connection option that specifies the command used to override the umask after copying a file or directory when using an SSH/SUDO connection.
      static boolean SUDO_OVERRIDE_UMASK_DEFAULT
      Default value (true) for the connection option that specifies whether or not to explicitly change the permissions with go+rX after uploading a file with scp.
      static java.lang.String SUDO_PASSWORD_PROMPT_REGEX
      Connection option (String) that specifies the regular expression to use when looking for in the output stream in interactive sudo before sending the password.
      static java.lang.String SUDO_PASSWORD_PROMPT_REGEX_DEFAULT
      Default value (.*[Pp]assword.*:) for the connection option that specifies which regular expression to look for in interactive sudo before sending the password.
      static java.lang.String SUDO_PRESERVE_ATTRIBUTES_ON_COPY_FROM_TEMP_FILE
      Connection option (Boolean) that specifies whether files are copied from the connection temporary directory using the -p flag to the cp command.
      static boolean SUDO_PRESERVE_ATTRIBUTES_ON_COPY_FROM_TEMP_FILE_DEFAULT
      Default value (true) for the connection option that specifies whether files are copied from the connection temporary directory using the -p flag to the cp command.
      static java.lang.String SUDO_PRESERVE_ATTRIBUTES_ON_COPY_TO_TEMP_FILE
      Connection option (Boolean) that specifies whether files are copied to the connection temporary directory using the -p flag to the cp command.
      static boolean SUDO_PRESERVE_ATTRIBUTES_ON_COPY_TO_TEMP_FILE_DEFAULT
      Default value (true) for the connection option that specifies whether files are copied to the connection temporary directory using the -p flag to the cp command.
      static java.lang.String SUDO_QUOTE_COMMAND
      Connection option (Boolean) that specifies whether or not to quote the original command when it is prefixed with SUDO_COMMAND_PREFIX.
      static boolean SUDO_QUOTE_COMMAND_DEFAULT
      Default value (false) for the connection option that specifies whether or not to quote the original command.
      static java.lang.String SUDO_TEMP_MKDIR_COMMAND

      static java.lang.String SUDO_TEMP_MKDIRS_COMMAND_DEFAULT
      Default value (mkdir -p -m 1777 {0}) for the connection option that specifies the command used to create a temporary directory using an SSH/SUDO connection.
      static java.lang.String SUDO_USERNAME
      Connection option (String) that specifies the username to sudo to for SUDO and INTERACTIVE_SUDO SSH connections.

    • Field Detail

      • SSH_PROTOCOL

        public static final java.lang.String SSH_PROTOCOL
        Name of the protocol handled by this connection builder, i.e. "ssh".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ALLOCATE_DEFAULT_PTY

        public static final java.lang.String ALLOCATE_DEFAULT_PTY
        Connection option (Boolean) that specifies whether a default pty ( dummy:80:24:0:0) should be allocated when executing a command. All sudo implementations require it for interactive sudo, some even require it for normal sudo. Some SSH server implementations (notably OpenSSH on AIX 5.3) crash when it is allocated.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ALLOCATE_DEFAULT_PTY_DEFAULT

        public static final boolean ALLOCATE_DEFAULT_PTY_DEFAULT
        Default value (false) for the connection option that specifies whether a default pty should be allocated when executing a command.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ALLOCATE_PTY

        public static final java.lang.String ALLOCATE_PTY
        Connection option (String) that specifies a specific pty that should be allocated when executing a command. The format is TERM:COLS:ROWS:WIDTH:HEIGTH e.g. xterm:80:24:0:0. If null or an empty string is specified, no pty is allocated. Overrides the ALLOCATE_DEFAULT_PTY option.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CONNECTION_TYPE

        public static final java.lang.String CONNECTION_TYPE
        Connection option (SshConnectionType) that specifies the SSH connection type to use.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public static final int SSH_PORT_DEFAULT
        Default value (22) for the connection option that specifies the port to connect to.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PRIVATE_KEY_FILE

        public static final java.lang.String PRIVATE_KEY_FILE
        Connection option (String) that specifies the private key file to use. N.B.: Private keys cannot be used when the SSH connection type is INTERACTIVE_SUDO because the password is needed for the password prompts.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUDO_INTERACTIVE_PASSWORD

        public static final java.lang.String SUDO_INTERACTIVE_PASSWORD
        Connection option (String) that specifies an alternate password to use for the password prompt for INTERACTIVE_SUDO SSH connections. When empty, the default password used for making the connection is used.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUDO_OVERRIDE_UMASK

        public static final java.lang.String SUDO_OVERRIDE_UMASK
        Connection option (Boolean) that specifies whether or not to explicitly change the permissions with chmod -R go+rX after uploading a file or directory with scp. Also see SUDO_OVERRIDE_UMASK_COMMAND.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OPEN_SHELL_BEFORE_EXECUTE

        public static final java.lang.String OPEN_SHELL_BEFORE_EXECUTE
        Connection option (Boolean) that specifies whether or not to open a shell directly before executing a remote command. This may be necessary in case a user does not yet have a home directory on a machine, and this is created for him when he opens a shell.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OPEN_SHELL_BEFORE_EXECUTE_DEFAULT

        public static final boolean OPEN_SHELL_BEFORE_EXECUTE_DEFAULT
        Default value (false) for the connection option that specifies whether or not to open a shell directory before executing a command.
        See Also:

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LIST_FILES_COMMAND_DEFAULT

        public static final java.lang.String LIST_FILES_COMMAND_DEFAULT
        Default value (ls -a1 {0}) for the connection option that specifies the command used to list files in a directory using an SSH/SCP connection. NOTE:: this *is* meant to be 'el es minus one'. Each file should go on a separate line, even if we create a pseudo-tty. Long format is NOT what we want here.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUDO_TEMP_MKDIR_COMMAND

        public static final java.lang.String SUDO_TEMP_MKDIR_COMMAND
        Connection option (String) that specifies the command used to create a temporary directory when using an SSH/SUDO connection. The placeholder {0} is replaced with the directory to create. Note: For SUDO access, temporary dirs also need to be writable to the connecting user, otherwise an SCP copy will fail. 1777 is world writable with the sticky bit set.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUDO_TEMP_MKDIR_COMMAND_DEFAULT

        public static final java.lang.String SUDO_TEMP_MKDIR_COMMAND_DEFAULT
        Default value (mkdir -m 1777 {0}) for the connection option that specifies the command used to create a temporary directory using an SSH/SUDO connection.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUDO_TEMP_MKDIRS_COMMAND

        public static final java.lang.String SUDO_TEMP_MKDIRS_COMMAND
        Connection option (String) that specifies the command used to create a temporary directory tree when using an SSH/SUDO connection. The placeholder {0} is replaced with the directory to create. Note: For SUDO access, temporary dirs also need to be writable to the connecting user, otherwise an SCP copy will fail. 1777 is world writable with the sticky bit set.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUDO_TEMP_MKDIRS_COMMAND_DEFAULT

        public static final java.lang.String SUDO_TEMP_MKDIRS_COMMAND_DEFAULT
        Default value (mkdir -p -m 1777 {0}) for the connection option that specifies the command used to create a temporary directory using an SSH/SUDO connection.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUDO_COPY_FROM_TEMP_FILE_COMMAND

        public static final java.lang.String SUDO_COPY_FROM_TEMP_FILE_COMMAND
        Connection option (String) that specifies the command used to copy files from the connection temporary directory when using an SSH/SUDO connection.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUDO_COPY_FROM_TEMP_FILE_COMMAND_DEFAULT_PRESERVE_ATTRIBUTES

        public static final java.lang.String SUDO_COPY_FROM_TEMP_FILE_COMMAND_DEFAULT_PRESERVE_ATTRIBUTES
        Default value (cp -pr {0} {1}) for the connection option that specifies the command used to copy files from the connection temporary directory while preserving the file attributes using an SSH/SUDO connection. See also SUDO_PRESERVE_ATTRIBUTES_ON_COPY_FROM_TEMP_FILE.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUDO_COPY_FROM_TEMP_FILE_COMMAND_DEFAULT_NO_PRESERVE_ATTRIBUTES

        public static final java.lang.String SUDO_COPY_FROM_TEMP_FILE_COMMAND_DEFAULT_NO_PRESERVE_ATTRIBUTES
        Default value (cp -r {0} {1}) for the connection option that specifies the command used to copy files from the connection temporary directory while not preserving the file attributes using an SSH/SUDO connection. See also SUDO_PRESERVE_ATTRIBUTES_ON_COPY_FROM_TEMP_FILE.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUDO_OVERRIDE_UMASK_COMMAND

        public static final java.lang.String SUDO_OVERRIDE_UMASK_COMMAND
        Connection option (String) that specifies the command used to override the umask after copying a file or directory when using an SSH/SUDO connection. The placeholder {0} is replaced with the copied file/directory.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUDO_OVERRIDE_UMASK_COMMAND_DEFAULT

        public static final java.lang.String SUDO_OVERRIDE_UMASK_COMMAND_DEFAULT
        Default value (chmod -R go+rX {0}) for the connection option that specifies the command used to override the umask after copying a file or directory when using an SSH/SUDO connection.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUDO_COPY_TO_TEMP_FILE_COMMAND

        public static final java.lang.String SUDO_COPY_TO_TEMP_FILE_COMMAND
        Connection option (String) that specifies the command used to copy files to the connection temporary directory when using an SSH/SUDO connection.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public OverthereConnection connect()
        Description copied from interface: OverthereConnectionBuilder
        Creates the connection that corresponds to the arguments that were passed in the two-arg constructor of this class. The first argument is a String that specifies the type (and is identical to the name field of the Protocol annotation). The second argument is the ConnectionOptions.
        Specified by:
        connect in interface OverthereConnectionBuilder
        Returns:
        the created connection.
